intro: Meibomia villosa, commonly known as the hairy meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough texture due to the presence of fine hairs. Meibomia villosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
